comments_since_last_sample.body: Right now market of cardamom is down

Their INSANE demands destroyed some of these small farms by indirectly pushing these workers to their limits. 

And yet, most of the profits goes to the importers/resellers/any kinds of middleman. 

I've seen these trends happening not just to cardamoms, but other "exotics" spices or fruits that usually grows by a small amount of farmers.
Iduki's farmers must declare a retail price for country and then they sell accordingly so customers must get it reasonable price and farmers get enough proper and they remove mediators or dalals
